author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We just bought $STMP. After substantial work, we believe short story is wrong & misleading - our initial thoughts - https://t.co/aY17G0APSm

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Disclosure: We bought $STMP on 7/19 and bought more today – Let us share a few opinions

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
Smart guys are behind the short thesis. Antics aside, we respect their work.
Smart guys were also behind short thesis on NFLX, MNST, etc

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Short thesis has thus far been factually invalidated as misleading/ever-changing arguments. We will focus on the message, not the messangers

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Worth considering source on much of $STMP "expert" industry work. Perhaps an axe to grind: https://t.co/F5ScLr3aCY

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Intuiship is not a shell company of $STMP as argument originally went; this is factually incorrect.  https://t.co/UXOY4LmvTb

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Intuiship customers, like all resellers', require an account with a PC postage co to print labels. STMP/Endicia has become a quasi monopoly

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Ecom mktplaces and resellers w/NSAs  are permitted/encouraged  to offer discounts to sub-50K package merchants (suggesting otherwise =wrong)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: These discounts (below CB but only as low as CPP) are offered everywhere, Shippo, Ebay, Etsy, Easy Post, etc https://t.co/JAlgoIuTGJ

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: This is not “abuse” but a strategy the USPS endorses to garner mkt share from UPS/FDX across smaller single carrier (or multi) ecomm

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: If $STMP was abusing ecosystem vs value add, then they would have disproportionate % of ecosystem economics & take rate would increase.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: THIS IS NOT THE CASE - in fact, contrary to short case, $STMP unit economics declined in Q2'16 to 6.2% from 6.4% (of $ postage printed)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: the USPS is gaining mkt share, SS/SW (owned by $STMP) are most robust s/w solution – and of course use $STMP for back-end/printing to their

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Multicarrier solutions have minuscule penetration rates & $STMP is cleaner & more robust API than USPS click n ship. What changes this?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: On NSA’s - PRC approves and monitors all NSA and runs elasticity-based test

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
NSAs must “improve the net financial position of the Postal Service” NET=key
NSAs must improve the operational efficiency of the USPS (yep)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Competitive NSAs must cover their attributable cost (reseller/PC Postage ecosystem splits not salient, $STMP gets more b/c massive value)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Competitive products as a whole must contribute 5.5 percent of Institutional costs, this too is easy to audit/track for individual NSA's

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: if believe reseller ecosystem serves its purpose and remains, then % to $STMP doesn't matter vs the holistic take rate.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: W/O change, $STMP is dominant company in a secular growth industry with small penetration rates, w/ annualized tax effected FCF rr of $120M

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Just bought back 2% of the company and authorized another 3% of the company with that FCF.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Aside from histrionics and arm waiving (HLF), $STMP partnership with USPS and unit economics are strengthening, =  long set-up, not short

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Finally, only a moron would play for a short squeeze in a stock with S/I just 2 days to cover and GC borrow with 1M+ on feeds

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
We’d like to think we aren’t morons, at least not intentionally
We’d also like to think we do reasonable work - https://t.co/ALRFlvW9UZ

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We’d also like to think hubris and arrogance are the Achilles Heels of most investors; we may be wrong, and if so, we will sell w/ impunity.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: @PresciencePoint finally, despite the harangues directed our way, PP does very good work. We just so happen to disagree on $STMP....

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
Today, we are sharing our opinion and thoughts on $CHGG. The initial opinion can be found here: 

https://t.co/ZYFr5MMKyu

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We expose $CHGG stock promote & “pivot” built on biz metrics & PF shenanigans & manipulation, & structurally broken biz model: 75% downside

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Believe $CHGG has repeatedly violated SEC Reg G & new C&DIs (SEC sent CHGG a letter within last year about its pro forma reporting. (1/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG has used multiple derivations of pro forma reporting. Result is financials don't reconcile. (2/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG has been recognizing one-time textbook liquidations in its "Adjusted" EBITDA results. They have not excluded these 1-time events (3/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG altered its Chegg Services (digital) definition multiple times & incl commission from textbook sales/transfers as "digital" revs (4/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We believe the result has been an overstatement of $CHGG digital revenue, growth, and profitability. (5/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG stated all-important digital rev growth = 60% in '16. Our analysis suggests blatant misrepresentation w/ dig rev. growth ~ 16% in 2016

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG calls itself a subscriber biz with 80% retention. We calculate retention of just 7% annually & show their sub numbers = inconsistent

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: In Q3'16, $CHGG claimed to have 800K customers and 23% YoY growth. Last year press release showed 825K customers. We believe growth < 16%

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG said CF+ Q3, but > 100% was due to delay in Ingram pmts. We think they exit 16 with < 60M of cash, a 25M burn & 35M earn out liability

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG claims no longer cap intinsive, yet capex as % of rev up 340% YoY. We think they increased capitalized expenses to fake EBITDA growth

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Peer group trades 5x - 11x EBITDA. Even at high-end (including 11M anti dilutive shares) $CHGG trades ~ $2.00, while 2017 estimates too high

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $AMZN launched Campus Pick up Point, Pearson/Follet partnering for digital @ 1200 bookstores & $BNED launched price match on textbooks $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $CHGG Q4'16 guidance implies low cost funnel (Required Materials) will decline YoY by 40% (b/c of competition)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Analysis of $CHGG Tutors pricing suggests GM's are not 60% as management has suggested, but closer to 30%.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We believe $CHGG will run out of money & needs to access capital mkts, hard b/c we also believe pro forma results are manipulated/fabricated

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
yesterday we shared our opinion/work on $CHGG (we are short the common)

https://t.co/ZYFr5N4lq2

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: today, we share a list of "mild-mannered" questions the sell-side should ask to at least create a perception of objectivity on $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
those 10 questions for $CHGG analyst day can be found here:

https://t.co/YP09tFHsWJ

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We understand why the sell-side blindly supports $CHGG - they burn cash & require serial acqusitions to obfuscate deteriorating performance

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Don't expect sell-side to ask challenging questions, but hope independet research analysts at least ask a few "non-softballs" for $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 1) Why doesn't $CHGG provide standard rev rec. table for “Adjusted PF Revs” which includes clean & consistent historical results for comps?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 2. Reconciling $CHGG Services with prior Digital Revenue metric (normalizing for eTextbooks and Ingram Commissions inclusion in both) (1/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 2. suggests $CHGG Services growth is just 16%. Can you detail how your 60% figure is calculated?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 3. Why does CEO repeatedly state that $CHGG generates "a lot of cash" when guidance for 2016 implies negative FCF?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 4. Excluding Ingram one-time catch up payments next year, what are the cash flow expectations for 2017? $CHGG

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 5. How does $CHGG account for inventory transfers to IM?  When CHGG buys textbook on IM, how is transaction captured in the fin statements?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 5. What was the specific Imagine Easy revenue contribution $CHGG recognized in Q3’16?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 6. Excl. Imagine Easy subscribers & the reclassification of eTextbook customers, what was $CHGG organic, apples:apples subscriber count (1/2

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 6. for $CHGG Services in Q3’16?  How does this compare to Q3’15, again on a clean apples-to-apples basis? (2/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 7. $CHGG failed to disclose any details regarding the “strategic equity” investment in Q3’16 – What was this investment?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 8. What is the gross margin for $CHGG Tutors? Why do your own publicly disclosed pricing metrics imply just a 33% gross margin vs your 60%+?

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 9. Why does $CHGG 2017 adjusted EBITDA guidance include $6 million of “acquisition-related compensation costs?” (1/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: 9. Are there additional acquisitions that $CHGG yet to disclose or have yet to occur that are included in the 2017 guidance? (2/2)

content: $AAPL novel approach = no wireless charging pads that require devices maintain specific points of contact and orien… https://t.co/qShAWChfzk

content: Basic understanding of semis & the diagram on Dialog’s own site clearly shows $WATT solution converts RF directly t… https://t.co/VAAVkkNZxK

content: Inductive Charging requires AC to be converted to DC using Bridge Rectifiers. https://t.co/qZ8uZRDZtY

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Lite-On Semi awarded Phone 8 Bridge Rectifier order for wireless charging (Digitimes) If $AAPL using Bridge Rectifiers, CANNOT be using WATT

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: The configuration diagram directly from Dialog confirms if $APPL using inductive charging, then no RF-DC conversion… https://t.co/Rzt95qvHxO

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: We believe the BS Edison Award release from $WATT was intended to cover up negative overnight iPhone 8 wireless charging news from Asia

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Overnight, KGI Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, most knowledgeable $AAPL source in Asia, issued report confirming iPhone 8 has inductive charging pad,

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Apple Daily confirmed iPhone 8 includes “charging blankets,” specifically stating wireless charging technology was incompatible with $WATT

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $WATT tried to cover up this news with promotional Edison Award release this AM (1/n)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $WATT said “Energous joins the ranks of previous Edison Award winners including: 3M, Nvidia, Logitech, GE, Lenovo, Tesla, SpaceX, Fitbit.”

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: $WATT cherry-picked list of winners ignored stock promotion Edison Award winners: $EYES, $NQ, $ONVO, $AMRS, 7779 JT, $DDD, & Theranos.

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: KGI analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, who repeatedly = most accurate unveiling future iPhone specs, issued report breaking new iPhone 8 details. $WATT

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Kuo said multiple iPhone 8 models, “bezel-less” design w/OLED display, glass casing, & indctve chgin w/close-range inductive mat. srry $WATT

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Apple Daily also reported overnight that the iPhone 8 would use inductive charging and that $WATT was not included https://t.co/KJmBwmFfOW

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Curiously timed blog post on tech rumor site Technadu titled “Apple iPhone 8 comes with 15 ft Wireless Charging System by Energous.”  $WATT

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: iPhone 8 design specs are complete, $WATT has no WattUp long range FCC approval, and KGI and Apple Daily reporting otherwise (1/2)

author: CopperfieldRscr
content:
Yet blog post on rumor site & Edison Award "news" hit for $WATT 12 hrs after overnight news. Tie together here (2/2)
https://t.co/BjdllYacFY

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: Bottom line on $WATT news: Multiple reputable sources from Asia = charging blankets & an inductive strategy tied to Pegatron. Very specific

author: CopperfieldRscr
content: On Edison Award, is $WATT the next $NVDA, $GE, $TSLA (its chosen comps), or the next $EYES, $NQ, $ONVO, $AMRS, $DDD or Theranos (winners 2)
